configuration.ets.baseSdkPath.descriptio: The default OpenHarmony SDK base path. All versions of SDKs will be installed under this path. (You can use `${os.homedir}` to get the home directory) (This path corresponds to the OpenHarmony SDK location in DevEco Studio settings)
configuration.ets.hdcPath.description: The path to the HDC tool, used for `hilog` and others.
configuration.ets.hmsPath.description: The path to the HMS SDK path. Because HMS SDK is independent of OpenHarmony SDK, it needs to be set separately. Generally, you can find the SDK in the DevEco Studio installation directory. (This path corresponds to the `sdk/default/harmony` path in the DevEco Studio installation directory)
configuration.ets.ignoreWorkspaceLocalPr: Ignore auto infer the base SDK path from `local.properties` file in the local workspace.
configuration.ets.lspDebugMode.descripti: Enable ETS Language Server debug logging.
configuration.ets.sdkPath.description: OpenHarmony SDK path. The ETS Language Server will be restarted when this setting is changed. (This path corresponds to the `sdk/default/openharmony` path in the DevEco Studio installation directory)
ets.language-server.restart.reloadWindow: ETS Language Server restarted! If the internal lib have any error or uncorrect, you can click this button to reload window.

qualifierEditor.description:
A qualifier directory is composed of one or more qualifier words that represent application scenarios or device characteristics. The qualifiers include Mobile Country Code and Mobile Network Code, language, text, country or region, landscape or portrait, device type, color mode, and screen density. Qualifiers are connected by underscores (_) or hyphens (-). When creating a qualifier directory, developers need to follow the following rules for qualifier directory naming.
  • the combination order: mcc_mnc-language_text_country_region-landscape_portrait-device_type-color_mode-screen_density. Developers can choose one or more qualifier words from the qualifiers to form the directory name based on the application usage scenarios and device characteristics.
  • The connection method: the Mobile Country Code and Mobile Network Code are connected by underscores (_), the language, text, and country or region are also connected by underscores (_), and other qualifiers are connected by hyphens (-). For example: mcc460_mnc00-zh_Hant_CN, zh_CN-car-ldpi.
  • The value range: the value of each qualifier must meet the conditions in the qualifier value requirements table, otherwise, the resource files in the directory cannot be matched.
qualifierEditor.locale.description: Represents the language type used by the device, consisting of 2-3 lowercase letters. For example: zh represents Chinese, en represents English, mai represents Maithili. For detailed value ranges, please refer to ISO 639 (ISO-specified language coding standards).
qualifierEditor.mccAndMnc.description: The value of Mobile Country Code (MCC) and Mobile Network Code (MNC) is obtained from the network registered by the device. MCC can be used together with MNC, using an underscore (_) to connect them, or used separately. For example: mcc460 represents China, mcc460_mnc00 represents China_China Mobile. For detailed value ranges, please refer to ITU-T E.212 (International Telecommunication Union related standards).
qualifierEditor.orientation.description: Represents the screen orientation of the device, the values are as follows: vertical portrait, horizontal landscape
qualifierEditor.device.description: Represents the type of device, the values are as follows: phone, car, tablet, tv, wearable, 2in1
qualifierEditor.title: Resource Qualifier Directory Editor
qualifierEditor.colorMode.description: Represents the color mode of the device, the values are as follows: dark: dark mode, light: light mode
qualifierEditor.density.description: Represents the density of the device, the values are as follows: sdpi: small density, mdpi: medium density, ldpi: large density, xldpi: extra large density, xxldpi: extra extra large density, xxxldpi: extra extra extra large density
qualifierEditor.docs.resource: Docs: Huawei Developer - Resource Categories and Access - Qualifiers Directory

viewWelcome.createProject:
Quickly create ArkTS projects using Naily's ArkTS Support.
[Create ArkTS Project](command:ets.createProject)
walkthroughs.ArkTS-Walkthrough.descripti: Help you setup OpenHarmony ArkTS development environment with your IDE.
walkthroughs.ArkTS-Walkthrough.steps.ins:
Install OpenHarmony SDK to support ArkTS development. 
[Install OpenHarmony SDK](command:ets.installSDK)
walkthroughs.ArkTS-Walkthrough.title: OpenHarmony ArkTS Setup
